relation: I do have to brag a little on campus safety because the OUPD are always out patrolling and we have had a few robberies but were dealt with in a good manor, which was the best for the student's safety

Being Athens if you're 21 or over it's fun to go to the bar (on the weekends) and dance/hang with friends. There is also the Ping Center where you can get a workout in, a golf course, tennis courts, you also have several clubs to chose from. Plenty to do if you have the time.
I haven't ate everywhere on campus yet but the places I've been such as Baker has some pretty good food, not too horribly priced.
From what my friends who live on campus have told me dorm life isn't too bad.
I'm an engineering student and must say it is not easy but the good side is the teachers are helpful and want to see you pass/succeed so they do what they can you just have to ask.
Talk to your teachers, ask questions, and find friends who can possibly give a review of a teacher ahead of picking a class. Oh and keep the gpa up and b.a.c down.

Ohio University is a really nice school. Most of the professors I've had are helpful and have no problem doing what they can to help you pass. Also has a nice presence because not being in a huge city, you can still get a country feel.
pageTitle: Ohio University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {883699=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 816021=Every college has sporting events, but one thing Ohio has that those others do not would have to be the Ohio University Marching 110. The 110 performs at all football and basketball games (men and women). They have performed around the world; from Rome and Ireland in 2013 to being invited to perform in China during the 60's. Along with the band though, the university's sports have been performing extremely well over the past few years, including 5 straight bowls for the football team, and a recent Sweet 16 run for the men's basketball team. There are other events that happen on Court Street in Athens, the craziest 1/2 mile in all of Ohio. Home to over 20 bars and a ton of restaurants, there is always something to do in Athens, Ohio!, 339987=I am not familiar with a lot at this time since school just started this week but there is a March 110 that takes all the incoming freshman. The band plays and marches across the main campus bridge with freshman class following them. It is really cool!, 645160=Halloween is HUGE at Ohio University. Rated the best campus to be on in the United States on Oct. 31st.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Ohio University is great for any type of student. There are so many groups, clubs, and other students here, that anyone can find what they are looking for. Tips for prospective students For those of you thinking of coming here to OU here are a few tips: 1. GO TO CLASS. This is probably the most important thing to do because, now that we are on our own, we have many distractions and fun things to do. However, you are here to get an education and the best way to do that is going to class. 2. Study: To do well on test and exams, do your work and study so that you will be prepared. Also by study you will most likely get better grades, making your parents happy and keeping you off academic probation. Bang for the buck Personally I believe Ohio University is expensive, especially for out of state students. From what me and my friends have learned from this past year, OU will try and take as much of your money as possible whenever they have the chance. With this said, OU will give you many opportunities and connections to help further your career. Also you will have a great quality education. Am
